contextId.information: The nominal adjective "uncircumcised" can be translated as an adjective. AT: "these men who have not been circumcised" Not being circumcised is a metonym for being foreigners. AT: "these non-Israelite men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
